meanings.sent1: The unicorn in the story was said to be inexistent.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure was believed to be inexistent by the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map led them to an inexistent island, much to their disappointment.
meanings.sent4: His hopes of finding a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow were inexistent.
meanings.sent5: The scientist searched for evidence of the inexistent creature in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The magical kingdom in the fairy tale was described as inexistent.
meanings.sent2: The invisible cloak was believed to be inexistent by many.
meanings.sent3: His excuses for being late were so creative, they bordered on the inexistent.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of flying felt so real, yet were ultimately inexistent.
